smells.name: LongMethod
smells.description: One method should have one responsibility. Long methods tend to handle many things at once. Prefer smaller methods to make them easier to understand.

instances.message: The function testOnCreate is too long. The maximum length is 20.
The function create is too long. The maximum length is 20.

smells.name: TooManyFunctions
smells.description: Too many functions inside a/an file/class/object/interface always indicate a violation of the single responsibility principle. Maybe the file/class/object/interface wants to manage to many things at once. Extract functionality which clearly belongs together.

instances.message: Class 'AndroidDatabase' with '11' functions detected. Defined threshold inside classes is set to '11'
Class 'SharedPreferencesStorage' with '12' functions detected. Defined threshold inside classes is set to '11'
File 'ViewExtensions.kt' with '13' functions detected. Defined threshold inside files is set to '11'
Class 'ListHabitsScreen' with '25' functions detected. Defined threshold inside classes is set to '11'
Class 'IntentFactory' with '12' functions detected. Defined threshold inside classes is set to '11'

smells.name: ComplexMethod
smells.description: Prefer splitting up complex methods into smaller, easier to understand methods.

instances.message: The function onItemSelected appears to be too complex.
The function toShortString appears to be too complex.
The function copyAttributesFrom appears to be too complex.

smells.name: LabeledExpression
smells.description: Expression with labels increase complexity and affect maintainability.

instances.message: Expression with labels increase complexity and affect maintainability.

smells.name: ComplexInterface
smells.description: An interface contains too many functions and properties. Large classes tend to handle many things at once. An interface should have one responsibility. Split up large interfaces into smaller ones that are easier to understand.

instances.message: The interface HabitsActivityComponent is too complex. Consider splitting it up.

smells.name: StringLiteralDuplication
smells.description: Multiple occurrences of the same string literal within a single file detected.

instances.message: Multiple occurrences of the same string literal within a single file detected.
Multiple occurrences of the same string literal within a single file detected.

smells.name: TooGenericExceptionThrown
smells.description: Thrown exception is too generic. Prefer throwing project specific exceptions to handle error cases.

instances.message: RuntimeException is a too generic Exception. Prefer throwing specific exceptions that indicate a specific error case.

smells.name: PrintStackTrace
smells.description: Do not print an stack trace. These debug statements should be replaced with a logger or removed.

instances.message: Do not print an stack trace. These debug statements should be replaced with a logger or removed.
Do not print an stack trace. These debug statements should be replaced with a logger or removed.

smells.name: TooGenericExceptionCaught
smells.description: Caught exception is too generic. Prefer catching specific exceptions to the case that is currently handled.

instances.message: Caught exception is too generic. Prefer catching specific exceptions to the case that is currently handled.

smells.name: FunctionNaming
smells.description: Function names should follow the naming convention set in the configuration.

instances.message: Function names should match the pattern: ^([a-z$][a-zA-Z$0-9]*)|(`.*`)$

smells.name: FunctionMinLength
smells.description: Function names should not be shorter than the minimum defined in the configuration.

instances.message: Function names should be at least 3 characters long.
Function names should be at least 3 characters long.

smells.name: VariableNaming
smells.description: Variable names should follow the naming convention set in the projects configuration.

instances.message: Private variable names should match the pattern: (_)?[a-z][A-Za-z0-9]*
Private variable names should match the pattern: (_)?[a-z][A-Za-z0-9]*

smells.name: TopLevelPropertyNaming
smells.description: Top level property names should follow the naming convention set in the projects configuration.

instances.message: Private top level property names should match the pattern: (_)?[A-Za-z][A-Za-z0-9]*
Private top level property names should match the pattern: (_)?[A-Za-z][A-Za-z0-9]*

smells.name: FunctionMaxLength
smells.description: Function names should not be longer than the maximum set in the project configuration.

instances.message: Function names should be at most 30 characters long.
Function names should be at most 30 characters long.

smells.name: ObjectPropertyNaming
smells.description: Property names inside objects should follow the naming convention set in the projects configuration.

instances.message: Private object property names should match the pattern: (_)?[A-Za-z][A-Za-z0-9]*

smells.name: UnnecessaryParentheses
smells.description: Unnecessary parentheses don't add any value to the code and should be removed.

instances.message: Parentheses in (networkInfo != null) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: networkInfo != null
Parentheses in (buttonWidth * buttonCount) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: buttonWidth * buttonCount

smells.name: MagicNumber
smells.description: Report magic numbers. Magic number is a numeric literal that is not defined as a constant and hence it's unclear what the purpose of this number is. It's better to declare such numbers as constants and give them a proper name. By default, -1, 0, 1, and 2 are not considered to be magic numbers.

instances.message: This expression contains a magic number. Consider defining it to a well named constant.

smells.name: UnnecessaryAbstractClass
smells.description: An abstract class is unnecessary and can be refactored. An abstract class should have both abstract and concrete properties or functions. An abstract class without a concrete member can be refactored to an interface. An abstract class without an abstract member can be refactored to a concrete class.

instances.message: An abstract class without a concrete member can be refactored to an interface.
An abstract class without a concrete member can be refactored to an interface.

smells.description: Restrict the number of return statements in methods.

Function getExecuteString has 7 return statements which exceeds the limit of 2.
Function getActionName has 4 return statements which exceeds the limit of 2.
Function parseIntent has 4 return statements which exceeds the limit of 2.

smells.name: UseDataClass
smells.description: Classes that do nothing but hold data should be replaced with a data class.

instances.message: The class Arguments defines nofunctionality and only holds data. Consider converting it to a data class.
The class CheckmarkIntentData defines nofunctionality and only holds data. Consider converting it to a data class.
The class WidgetDimensions defines nofunctionality and only holds data. Consider converting it to a data class.

smells.name: NoTabs
smells.description: Checks if tabs are used in Kotlin files.

Tab character is in use.

smells.name: SpacingBetweenPackageAndImports
smells.description: Violation of the package declaration style.

instances.message: There should be exactly one empty line in between the list of imports and the declaration of AndroidNotificationTray.

smells.name: MayBeConst
smells.description: Reports vals that can be const val instead.

instances.message: REMINDERS_CHANNEL_ID can be a `const val`.
